snippet: Starting bipartisan talks in the Senate to put pressure on the House may become a more formalized process as President Obama and lawmakers grapple with other fiscal deadlines.
abstract: Talks between White House, Senate Republicans and Senate Democrats that secured path around looming fiscal crisis may point way forward for Pres Obama as he tries to navigate his second term around House Republicans intent on blocking his agenda in 113th Congress.
lead_paragraph: Starting bipartisan talks in the Senate to put pressure on the House may become a more formalized process as President Obama and lawmakers grapple with other fiscal deadlines.

headline.seo: Tax Deal Shows Possible Path Around House G.O.P. in Fiscal Fights
headline.main: Tax Deal Shows Possible Path Around House G.O.P. in Fiscal Fights to Come
headline.print_headline: Tax Deal Shows Possible Path Around House G.O.P. in Fiscal Fights to Come
